name: Vietnamese Pork Spare Rib Soup with Opo Squash (Canh Sườn Nấu Bầu)
description: Nothing reminds me more of home than a warm bowl of soup. Here is a classic Vietnamese soup made with short pieces of pork ribs and opo squash. Enjoy with steamed rice for a complete meal.
keywords: Vietnamese pork spare rib soup with opo squash, canh suon nau bau, canh recipe, Vietnamese canh recipe, how to make Vietnamese soup, pork rib soup, opo squash, traditional Vietnamese soup with pork ribs, Asian soup with pork ribs, Vietnamese soup with pork, Vietnamese soup with squash, Vietnamese soup with opo squash, opo squash soup, canh bau, canh suon, canh bau nuon, how to make canh bau with pork ribs, Vietnamese opo squash soup, Vietnamese pork rib soup, Vietnamese pork rib soup recipe, Vietnamese opo squash soup recipe, Vietnamese recipes, Vietnamese canh recipes, Vietnamese soup recipes, traditional Vietnamese soup recipes, authentic Vietnamese soup for home cooking, Vietnamese home cooking soup, Vietnamese home cooking

video.name: Classic Vietnamese Soup Dish: Pork Spare Rib Soup with Opo Squash (Canh Suon Nau Bau)
video.description: Classic Vietnamese Soup Dish: Pork Spare Rib Soup with Opo Squash (Canh Sườn Nấu Bầu). A traditional soup side dish to eat with steamed rice.

recipeIngredient: 1 lb pork spare ribs (cut into bite-sized pieces)
1 small opo squash (peel and cut into thick matchsticks)
recipeInstructions: In a medium pot, add oil and heat on high. Add shallots and garlic. Fry until fragrant (about 30 seconds).

Add pork ribs and toss in the aromatics. Pan fry for 2 minutes or until nicely caramelized on the outside. Add half of the seasonings directly onto the pork ribs: chicken bouillon powder, salt, fish sauce, and sugar. Toss to coat.

Add water. Bring the pot to a low simmer and cook for 30 minutes or until pork ribs are chopstick tender. Skim off the impurities at the top. You can also remove the aromatics as they already served their purpose.
Add squash. Cook for an additional 2 minutes or until squash is tender. Add remaining seasonings to taste. Garnish with cilantro and ground black pepper.
